alert.note: Alert for Merrimack (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 21 at 3:12PM EDT until July 21 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM EDT FOR NORTHERN HILLSBOROUGH AND SOUTHWESTERN MERRIMACK COUNTIES... At 312 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Hancock, or 11 miles north of Jaffrey, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Manchester, Concord, Henniker, Hooksett, Peterborough, Hopkinton, New Boston, Antrim, Greenfield, Lyndeborough, Francestown, Bennington, Harrisville, Windsor, Hancock, Goffstown, Deering, Hillsborough, Weare and Bow. This includes the following highways... Interstate 293 between mile markers 8 and 11. Interstate 89 between mile markers 3 and 13. Interstate 93 between mile markers 23 and 26. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
